info.title: athena-dhcpd API
info.description: REST API for athena-dhcpd — an RFC-compliant DHCPv4 server with built-in high availability, conflict detection, dynamic DNS, DNS proxy, and web management.

tags.name: Config - Import/Export
tags.description: TOML config import, raw view, and validation

tags.name: HA Status
tags.description: High availability runtime status and failover

basicAuth.description: HTTP Basic auth against configured users

queryToken.name: token
queryToken.description: Query parameter token for SSE/streaming connections

primary_url.description: URL of the primary node to redirect to

example.error: this node is standby — config changes must be made on the primary

listen_address.description: host:port to listen for HA sync

vip.description: Virtual IP in CIDR notation, e.g. 10.0.0.100/24

HAStandby.description: Node is HA standby — writes must go to primary

get.description: Returns Prometheus-formatted metrics. No authentication required.

200.description: Prometheus metrics in text exposition format

get.description: Returns server health status. No authentication required.

post.description: Authenticates a user and sets a session cookie. No prior authentication required.

200.description: Login successful. Session cookie is set.

post.description: Destroys the session and clears the cookie. No prior authentication required.

get.description: Returns the current authentication state. If no users are configured, returns needs_user_setup. No prior authentication required — this endpoint self-reports auth state.
Returns all configured users without password hashes. Requires admin role.

post.description: Creates a new user or updates an existing one. If NO users exist yet, this endpoint does not require auth (allows initial admin account creation). Otherwise requires admin role.

delete.description: Removes a user account. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns all DHCP leases with optional filtering by subnet, MAC, hostname, state, and IP range. Supports pagination.
Exports all leases in CSV format. Supports the same query filters as list leases.
Returns a single DHCP lease by IP address.

delete.description: Removes a DHCP lease by IP address. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns all DHCP reservations across all subnets with global IDs.

post.description: Creates a new DHCP reservation. Requires admin role.

put.description: Updates an existing reservation by global ID. Supports partial updates. Requires admin role.

delete.description: Deletes a reservation by global ID. Requires admin role.

post.description: Imports reservations from CSV or JSON. Requires admin role.

get.description: Exports all reservations in CSV format.
Returns all configured subnets with runtime statistics (utilization, active leases).
Returns all IP pools with allocation statistics.
Returns all currently active IP conflicts.
Returns historical conflict detection records.
Returns summary statistics about IP conflicts.
Returns conflict details for a specific IP address.

delete.description: Removes a conflict entry for the given IP. Requires admin role.

post.description: Permanently excludes an IP from the allocation pool. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns overall server statistics including lease counts, uptime, and DHCP message counters.
Returns all subnets from the database config store.

post.description: Creates a new subnet configuration. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby nodes.

put.description: Updates an existing subnet by network CIDR. Supports partial updates. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

delete.description: Deletes a subnet by network CIDR. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns reservations for a specific subnet by network CIDR.

post.description: Adds a reservation to a specific subnet. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

delete.description: Removes a reservation by MAC from a specific subnet. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

post.description: Imports reservations from CSV or JSON into a specific subnet. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns global default DHCP options.

put.description: Updates global default DHCP options. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns conflict detection settings.

put.description: Updates conflict detection settings. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns high availability configuration. Read from TOML config file (not database).

put.description: Updates HA configuration. Writes directly to the TOML config file. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns event hook configuration.

put.description: Updates event hook configuration. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns dynamic DNS configuration.

put.description: Updates dynamic DNS configuration. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns DNS proxy configuration.

put.description: Updates DNS proxy configuration. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns hostname sanitisation pipeline settings.

put.description: Updates hostname sanitisation settings. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns remote syslog forwarding configuration.

put.description: Updates remote syslog forwarding configuration. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns device fingerprinting configuration.

put.description: Updates device fingerprinting configuration. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

post.description: Imports a full TOML configuration into the database config store. Requires admin role. Blocked on HA standby.

get.description: Returns the running configuration as raw TOML text.

post.description: Validates a TOML config string without applying it. Returns validation errors if any.

get.description: Returns recent events from the event bus.
Server-Sent Events stream of live events. Sends a stream.hello message on connect and keepalive comments every 30s. Use EventSource API or query parameter token for auth.
Returns all configured hooks and their status.

post.description: Fires a test event through the event bus to verify webhooks. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns audit log entries with optional filtering.
Exports audit log records as CSV. Supports same query filters as audit query.
Returns summary statistics about the audit log.
Returns all known device fingerprints.
Returns fingerprint statistics including total devices, breakdown by type and OS.
Returns the device fingerprint for a specific MAC address.
Returns all detected rogue DHCP servers.
Returns rogue detection statistics.

post.description: Acknowledges a rogue DHCP server to suppress repeated alerts. Requires admin role.
Removes a rogue server entry by server IP. Requires admin role.
Triggers an immediate scan for rogue DHCP servers. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns the full network topology tree built from relay agent data.
Returns topology summary statistics.

post.description: Sets a custom label on a topology node (switch or port). Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns the current anomaly detection status as a network weather-style indicator.
Returns statistics about the OUI database.
Returns the manufacturer for a MAC address from the built-in OUI database.
Returns all configured RADIUS subnets.

post.description: Tests connectivity to a RADIUS server. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns RADIUS configuration for a specific subnet with secret redacted.

put.description: Sets RADIUS configuration for a subnet. Requires admin role.

delete.description: Removes RADIUS configuration for a subnet. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns all port automation rules.

put.description: Replaces all port automation rules. Requires admin role.

post.description: Tests port automation rules against a sample lease context. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns current HA state including role, state, active status, last heartbeat, peer connection, and VIP status.

post.description: Triggers a manual HA failover to make this node active. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns configured floating VIP entries.

put.description: Replaces the entire VIP list. Validates entries and hot-reloads the VIP group. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns the runtime status of all VIPs including whether each is held and present on the interface.
Returns DNS proxy statistics including queries, cache, and filter lists.

post.description: Flushes the DNS response cache. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns all local DNS zone records with name, type, value, and TTL.
Returns status of all DNS filter lists including loaded status and domain counts.

post.description: Forces refresh of all or specific DNS filter lists. Requires admin role.

name.description: Optional: specific list name to refresh. Omit to refresh all.

post.description: Tests a domain against DNS filter lists and returns the result.

get.description: Returns recent DNS query log entries with pagination.
Streams live DNS query log entries via Server-Sent Events.

200.description: SSE stream of DNS query log entries

get.description: Returns whether setup is needed. No authentication required.

post.description: Saves HA configuration during setup wizard. Optionally writes TLS certificate files. Locked after setup is complete.

example.error: setup wizard is locked — setup already complete

post.description: Applies initial DHCP/DNS configuration during setup. Includes defaults, subnets, conflict detection, DNS, and DDNS settings. Locked after setup is complete.
Marks setup as complete and triggers service startup. Locked after setup is complete.

get.description: Exports a full backup including config sections, leases, and users as JSON. Requires admin role.

post.description: Restores config sections and users from a backup JSON file. HA config is skipped. Requires admin role.
